fullDescription.text: An object that was allocated with 'malloc' or 'new' is being freed using a mismatching 'free' or 'delete'.

properties.name: Mismatching new/free or malloc/delete
properties.description: An object that was allocated with 'malloc' or 'new' is being freed using a mismatching 'free' or 'delete'.

shortDescription.text: Call to alloca in a loop

fullDescription.text: Using alloca in a loop can lead to a stack overflow

properties.name: Call to alloca in a loop
properties.description: Using alloca in a loop can lead to a stack overflow

fullDescription.text: Adding a value to a pointer to check if it overflows relies on undefined behavior and may lead to memory corruption.

properties.name: Pointer overflow check
properties.description:
Adding a value to a pointer to check if it overflows relies
              on undefined behavior and may lead to memory corruption.

fullDescription.text: Using the return value from snprintf without proper checks can cause overflow.

properties.name: Potentially overflowing call to snprintf
properties.description: Using the return value from snprintf without proper checks can cause overflow.

shortDescription.text: Too few arguments to formatting function

fullDescription.text: Calling a printf-like function with too few arguments can be a source of security issues.

properties.name: Too few arguments to formatting function
properties.description:
Calling a printf-like function with too few arguments can be
              a source of security issues.

shortDescription.text: Wrong type of arguments to formatting function

fullDescription.text: Calling a printf-like function with the wrong type of arguments causes unpredictable behavior.

properties.name: Wrong type of arguments to formatting function
properties.description:
Calling a printf-like function with the wrong type of arguments causes unpredictable
              behavior.

shortDescription.text: Upcast array used in pointer arithmetic

fullDescription.text: An array with elements of a derived struct type is cast to a pointer to the base type of the struct. If pointer arithmetic or an array dereference is done on the resulting pointer, it will use the width of the base type, leading to misaligned reads.

properties.name: Upcast array used in pointer arithmetic
properties.description:
An array with elements of a derived struct type is cast to a
              pointer to the base type of the struct. If pointer arithmetic or
              an array dereference is done on the resulting pointer, it will
              use the width of the base type, leading to misaligned reads.

shortDescription.text: Call to function with fewer arguments than declared parameters

fullDescription.text: A function call is passing fewer arguments than the number of declared parameters of the function. This may indicate that the code does not follow the author's intent. It is also a vulnerability, since the function is likely to operate on undefined data.

properties.name: Call to function with fewer arguments than declared parameters
properties.description:
A function call is passing fewer arguments than the number of
              declared parameters of the function. This may indicate
              that the code does not follow the author's intent. It is also
              a vulnerability, since the function is likely to operate on
              undefined data.

shortDescription.text: Multiplication result converted to larger type

fullDescription.text: A multiplication result that is converted to a larger type can be a sign that the result can overflow the type converted from.

properties.name: Multiplication result converted to larger type
properties.description:
A multiplication result that is converted to a larger type can
              be a sign that the result can overflow the type converted from.

fullDescription.text: Testing for overflow by adding a value to a variable to see if it "wraps around" works only for unsigned integer values.

properties.name: Signed overflow check
properties.description:
Testing for overflow by adding a value to a variable
              to see if it "wraps around" works only for
              unsigned integer values.

shortDescription.text: Bad check for overflow of integer addition

fullDescription.text: Checking for overflow of integer addition by comparing against one of the arguments of the addition does not work when the result of the addition is automatically promoted to a larger type.

properties.name: Bad check for overflow of integer addition
properties.description:
Checking for overflow of integer addition by comparing
              against one of the arguments of the addition does not work
              when the result of the addition is automatically promoted
              to a larger type.

fullDescription.text: Allocating a buffer using 'malloc' without ensuring that there is always space for the entire string and a zero terminator can cause a buffer overrun.

properties.name: No space for zero terminator
properties.description:
Allocating a buffer using 'malloc' without ensuring that
              there is always space for the entire string and a zero
              terminator can cause a buffer overrun.

fullDescription.text: Including user-supplied data in a SQL query without neutralizing special elements can make code vulnerable to SQL Injection.

properties.name: Uncontrolled data in SQL query
properties.description:
Including user-supplied data in a SQL query without
              neutralizing special elements can make code vulnerable
              to SQL Injection.

fullDescription.text: Use of a standard library function that does not guard against buffer overflow.

properties.name: Use of dangerous function
properties.description: Use of a standard library function that does not guard against buffer overflow.

fullDescription.text: Using `cin` without specifying the length of the input may be dangerous.

properties.name: Dangerous use of 'cin'
properties.description:
Using `cin` without specifying the length of the input
              may be dangerous.

fullDescription.text: Use of a standard library function that is not thread-safe.

properties.name: Use of potentially dangerous function
properties.description: Use of a standard library function that is not thread-safe.

fullDescription.text: Buffer write operations with a length parameter that does not match the size of the destination buffer may overflow.

properties.name: Badly bounded write
properties.description:
Buffer write operations with a length parameter that
              does not match the size of the destination buffer may
              overflow.

shortDescription.text: Use of a version of OpenSSL with Heartbleed

fullDescription.text: Using an old version of OpenSSL can allow remote attackers to retrieve portions of memory.

properties.name: Use of a version of OpenSSL with Heartbleed
properties.description:
Using an old version of OpenSSL can allow remote
              attackers to retrieve portions of memory.

fullDescription.text: Explicitly scaled pointer arithmetic expressions can cause buffer overflow conditions if the offset is also implicitly scaled.

properties.name: Suspicious add with sizeof
properties.description:
Explicitly scaled pointer arithmetic expressions
              can cause buffer overflow conditions if the offset is also
              implicitly scaled.

shortDescription.text: CGI script vulnerable to cross-site scripting

fullDescription.text: Writing user input directly to a web page allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

properties.name: CGI script vulnerable to cross-site scripting
properties.description:
Writing user input directly to a web page
              allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

fullDescription.text: Using externally-controlled format strings in printf-style functions can lead to buffer overflows or data representation problems.

properties.name: Uncontrolled format string
properties.description:
Using externally-controlled format strings in
              printf-style functions can lead to buffer overflows
              or data representation problems.

fullDescription.text: Using externally-controlled format strings in printf-style functions can lead to buffer overflows or data representation problems.

properties.name: Uncontrolled format string (through global variable)
properties.description:
Using externally-controlled format strings in
              printf-style functions can lead to buffer overflows
              or data representation problems.

shortDescription.text: Cast between HRESULT and a Boolean type

fullDescription.text: Casting an HRESULT to/from a Boolean type and then using it in a test expression will yield an incorrect result because success (S_OK) in HRESULT is indicated by a value of 0.

properties.name: Cast between HRESULT and a Boolean type
properties.description: Casting an HRESULT to/from a Boolean type and then using it in a test expression will yield an incorrect result because success (S_OK) in HRESULT is indicated by a value of 0.

shortDescription.text: Comparison of narrow type with wide type in loop condition

fullDescription.text: Comparisons between types of different widths in a loop condition can cause the loop to behave unexpectedly.

properties.name: Comparison of narrow type with wide type in loop condition
properties.description:
Comparisons between types of different widths in a loop
              condition can cause the loop to behave unexpectedly.

fullDescription.text: Allocating memory with a size controlled by an external user can result in integer overflow.

properties.name: Overflow in uncontrolled allocation size
properties.description:
Allocating memory with a size controlled by an external
              user can result in integer overflow.

fullDescription.text: Casting a byte string to a wide-character string is likely to yield a string that is incorrectly terminated or aligned. This can lead to undefined behavior, including buffer overruns.

properties.name: Cast from char* to wchar_t*
properties.description:
Casting a byte string to a wide-character string is likely
              to yield a string that is incorrectly terminated or aligned.
              This can lead to undefined behavior, including buffer overruns.

shortDescription.text: Setting a DACL to NULL in a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR

fullDescription.text: Setting a DACL to NULL in a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR will result in an unprotected object. If the DACL that belongs to the security descriptor of an object is set to NULL, a null DACL is created. A null DACL grants full access to any user who requests it; normal security checking is not performed with respect to the object.

properties.name: Setting a DACL to NULL in a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR
properties.description:
Setting a DACL to NULL in a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR will result in an unprotected object.
              If the DACL that belongs to the security descriptor of an object is set to NULL, a null DACL is created.
              A null DACL grants full access to any user who requests it;
              normal security checking is not performed with respect to the object.
